content: Multi-purpose stadium in Yishun, Singapore **Yishun Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Yishun](/wiki/Yishun), Singapore, within the vicinity of [Khatib MRT station](/wiki/Khatib_MRT_station). The stadium has a capacity of 3,400. ## History - **1996 to 2003**: Home to the [Sembawang Rangers](/wiki/Sembawang_Rangers_FC). - **[2006 S.League](/wiki/2006_S.League) Season**: [Sporting Afrique](/wiki/Sporting_Afrique_FC) played their home games at the stadium. - **2007 to 2009**: Home to the [Yishun Super Reds](/wiki/Super_Reds_FC). - **[2010 S.League](/wiki/2010_S.League) Season**: [Beijing Guoan Talent](/wiki/Beijing_Guoan_FC_(Singapore)) played their home games at the stadium. - **[2012 S.League](/wiki/2012_S.League) Season**: [Harimau Muda A](/wiki/Harimau_Muda_A) played their home games at the stadium. - **[2015 S.League](/wiki/2015_S.League) Season**: [Home United](/wiki/Home_United) moved from [Bishan Stadium](/wiki/Bishan_Stadium) to Yishun Stadium as their primary stadium. ## International fixtures DateCompetitionTeamScoreTeam13 November 2014[Friendly](/wiki/Friendly_(football)) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)2–0 [Laos](/wiki/Laos_national_football_team)17 November 2014 [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)4–2 [Cambodia](/wiki/Cambodia_national_football_team) 1°24′45″N 103°49′56″E﻿ / ﻿1.412389°N 103.832334°E﻿ / 1.412389; 103.832334 This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Yishun Stadium
